str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From mathetes; intransitively, to become a pupil; transitively, to disciple, i.e. Enrol as scholar.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A head of a household. From oikos and despotes; the head of a family.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A store-house for precious things; hence: a treasure, a store. From tithemi; a deposit, i.e. Wealth.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
And, even, also, namely.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
